Among them, what are the five unsurpassed?
Taking rebirth is unsurpassed.

Among them, what are the five meagernesses?
Namely, the meagerness of an uncivilized place.
The meagerness of afflictions.

Among them, what are the five calamities?
If one steals objects from the Three Jewels,
They will become emaciated and rotten, and will take their own lives.
This is the first calamity.
The virtuous monks do not know or see the three kinds of slander.
Whether it is in the precepts, in the wrong views, or in the improper deportment.

Next, there is a person who slanders the Buddha's teachings.
Using the words and flavors brought by Mara, he teaches the Dharma that is spoken by the wrong path.
He teaches others to abide in it and encourages them to study it.
Because of this karma, when reborn as a human, he will become insane.

Next, there is a kind of person who becomes a king anointed by the kshatriyas.

When their bodies perish and their lives end, they are reborn in hell.

this great trichiliocosm world burns with blazing flames, all in one direction.

This is the fifth disaster.
These are the five disasters.

If there are bhiká¹£us who engage in divisive speech to cause disharmony,

What are the five characteristics of the continuity of the body in nirvana?ğŸ”½In the supreme meaning, this body is to be abhorred.

In the supreme meaning, this body is able to deceive.
These are the five characteristics of the continuity of the body in nirvana.
There are also five characteristics of the cessation of the continuity of the body.
Namely, when a man sees a woman giving birth, he gives rise to thoughts of disgust and detachment in the midst of that.
This is the first characteristic of the cessation of the continuity of the body.
Furthermore, there is a man who sees a woman afflicted with bodily ailments and gives rise to thoughts of disgust and detachment.
This is the second characteristic of the cessation of the body and the continuity of bondage.
Furthermore, there is a man who, having seen the foul stench of a woman, smells the stench on himself.
He then gives rise to thoughts of disgust and detachment.
This is the third bondage of the continuity of the body to be eliminated.
Next, there is a person who, whether it be a woman or a man,
hears a foul smell from the armpits or the anus,

This is the fourth bondage of the continuity of the body to be eliminated.
Next, there is a wise person who gives rise to a thought of non-reliance towards a woman.
This is the fifth bondage of the continuity of the body to be eliminated.
These five dharmas always give rise to thoughts.

When separated from what is loved, one grasps at things as real.
Because of conceptualization and discrimination.
Among them, the pain of karma means
this is defiled karma.
What, among them, are the defilements?
They are bodily karma, verbal karma, and mental karma.
Why is it so?ğŸ”½Because the mind is predominant.
Because the mind is foremost.
Next, there are words and phrases.
Among them, there is good bodily karma, verbal karma, and mental karma.
However, the TathÄgata still speaks of mental karma as defiled.
Why is it so?
That is precisely karma.
If there is that karma, but one does not experience the results and exhausts afflictions,
the TathÄgata speaks of exhausting karma and exhausting afflictions.
Among them, the ripening of results is complete.
One should experience what is black or white.
If there is something to be experienced, that is precisely suffering.
If that is precisely suffering, that is precisely pain.
Because of the cause of pain, there is a place of pain, a dependent place to abide.
Furthermore, there is a brief explanation of five kinds of pain.
The TathÄgata has spoken.
What are the five?
In the midst of the afflictions of cyclic existence,
The realms of hell, animals, Yama's world, gods, and humans.
